definition: to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
four/4
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai

sentences.english: Traditional Beijing roast duck is famous all over the world with a hundred years of history.
sentences.chinese: 老北京前門烤鴨名揚四海，至今已有百餘年的歷史。

sentences.english: Her worldwide fame is his support.
sentences.chinese: 她名揚四海應歸功於他的支持。

sentences.english: Then their love story is world-famous.
sentences.chinese: 於是那愛情故事名揚四海。

sentences.english: Her worldwide fame is due to his support.
sentences.chinese: 她名揚四海應歸功於他的支持。

sentences.english: This young man should do well, and may even rise to great fame .
sentences.chinese: 這個年輕人一定會做得很出色，甚至還可能名揚四海。

sentences.english: I'm gonna make it to heaven, Light up the sky like a flame fame.
sentences.chinese: 我要在天堂舞蹈，火光照亮天際名揚四海。
我們的交戰將會名揚四海。

sentences.english: is best known for his book A Brief History of Time.
sentences.chinese: 霍金教授因其《時間簡史》一書而名揚四海。
記住我的名字名揚四海。

sentences.english: "Shuan Yangrou" of Dong-Lai-Shun is world renowned I know.
sentences.chinese: 我知道東來順的涮羊肉名揚四海。

definition: to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
mulberry farming/to grow mulberry for sericulture
ceremony
to be completely unrelated to one another (idiom)/irrelevant
pinyin: feng1 ma3 niu2 bu4 xiang1 ji2

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
loyal/sincere/sound
talented field commander (military)
respect for the wise
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
enormously proud of one's success (idiom); smug/complacent
courage/bravery
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
